definition: abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]

pinyin: Sha1 te4 A1 la1 bo2 ren2

sentences.chinese: 要求我們阿拉伯人，”哈拉夫說。

sentences.english: They referred to my olive-skinned sister as “the Arab.”
sentences.chinese: 他們稱我的有着橄欖色皮膚的姐姐爲“阿拉伯人”。

sentences.english: Do you find it interesting to watch two Arabians talking?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲觀察兩個阿拉伯人談話很有趣嗎？

sentences.english: It was broadcast by al-Arabiya TV on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 這個錄音在週日由阿拉伯人電視臺播出了。

sentences.english: Arabians have been dressing like this for over 2, 000 years.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人這樣穿已經有兩千多年了。

sentences.english: It is for the Arabs themselves to create this more hopeful world.
sentences.chinese: 這是阿拉伯人自己創造的更加充滿希望的世界。

sentences.english: Arabs ride on camels which travel in deserts for days without drinking.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人騎駱駝在沙漠中穿行數日可以不喝水。

sentences.english: This is the first time that the outbreak of demonstrations in cities and towns inhabited by Arabs.
sentences.chinese: 今次亦是首次有阿拉伯人聚居城鎮爆發示威。

sentences.english: An Arab was walking along in the desert when he met two men.
sentences.chinese: 一個阿拉伯人正獨自在沙漠中走，這時他碰見兩個人。

sentences.english: Like the Hindus, the Arabs worked freely with irrationals.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人也象印度人那樣隨便使用無理數。

sentences.english: People from north african countries have an arabic rather than a negroid appearance.
sentences.chinese: 北非人具有阿拉伯人的外表，跟黑人不一樣。

sentences.english: Suddenly the Arab took out a knife, pressed a button and began to stab Glue.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人突然抽出刀，按動按扭，朝格魯直刺過去。

sentences.english: And the Arab stands in front of my telling me that he is going to close.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人正站在我面前，告訴我他要打烊了。

sentences.english: Still crouching in his corner, the Arab sits with his hands clasped around his feet.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人還是蹲坐在角落裏，兩手環扣，抱住雙腿。

sentences.english: Arabs are inordinately proud of their linguistic heritage.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人對他們的語言遺產極其自豪。

sentences.english: Tanner yanked the gun free of the Arab.
sentences.chinese: 坦納把槍從阿拉伯人手中扯過來。

definition: the Six-Day War of June 1967 between Israel and its Arab neighbors
the Copts, major ethnoreligious group of Egyptian Christians
Umayyad Empire (661-750, in Iberia -1031), successor of the Rashidun caliphate

pinyin: Mei3 suo3 bu4 da2 mi3 ya4
